# Test
::: {.column-page}
```{python}
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import numpy as np

# Data
years = np.arange(1, 6)
quarry_names = ['Crimson Crocodile', 'Smog Singers', 'Sunstalker', 'King', 'Crimson Crocodile']
quarry_levels = [1, 1, 2, 3, 2]
nemesis_names = ['Manhunter', None, 'Atnas', None, 'Black Knight']
nemesis_levels = [1, None, 1, None, 2]

# Set up figure
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(10, 4))

# Plot quarries
for i, (name, level) in enumerate(zip(quarry_names, quarry_levels)):
    ax.scatter(years[i], name, s=level*100, color='skyblue', label='Quarry' if i == 0 else "")

# Plot nemeses
for i, (name, level) in enumerate(zip(nemesis_names, nemesis_levels)):
    if name is not None:
        ax.scatter(years[i], name, s=level*100, color='salmon', label='Nemesis' if i == 0 else "")

# Add labels and title
ax.set_xlabel('Years')
ax.set_ylabel('Monster Fought')
ax.set_title('Kingdom Death Campaign: Quarry and Nemesis Progression')

# Legend and layout
plt.legend()
plt.tight_layout()
plt.show()

```
:::
